cab.content: Military Secret. 1355m Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,9th April 1920.(Received 10th.)9th April. No. 179:-Part I. (1) Rifles beginning to come in again slowly from Afridis. Nadir Khan reported to have offered to enlist Afridis in Ningrahar on Rs. 16 a month and free rations, Afridis to provide own rifles.(2) Further instalments of fines and Government rifles received from Tochi Wazirs, and rifles coming in slowly from Mahsuds.(3) Another unsuccessful attempt on army life about 15th March is reported. (4) At Durbar on 21st March, question of sending delegates to India discussed. Nadir Khan and strong party reported opposed doing so.(5) Bolsheviks in Kabul spreading stories of fighting on Herat border between British and Bolsheviks. Their influence in Kabul said to be increasing. (6) Afghan 5-rupee notes reported in circulation.Part II. (7) Derajat column commenced advance Upper Baddar Toi Valley on 6th, when three towers were destroyed. Our casualties two wounded.(8) Column continued advance on 7th, and three dominating towers above Giga Khel destroyed; enemy, estimated 300 strong, offered sniping opposition. Our casualties four killed, 26 wounded. Enemy's casualties apparently considerable. Paras. 3, 4 and 5 not communicated to Press.
